text: <@U1Y2R5C9L>  I run the SDK deploy method, get an error :description=open /var/hyperledger/production/crypto/client/ks/raw/eca.cert.chain: no such file or directory
<@U1AU8DRQR> I think member services data folder needs to be cleaned up.

<@U0YNFB22X> Where can we find that `member services data folder` ? I remember seeing this issue in the first run ... Incase If you are referring `/var/hyperledger/production` I deleted that re-ran the program too

<@U1AU8DRQR> It is a documentation update in the read me file, but until it is updated, you can do the following to get test cases pass:
1.  remove /var/hyperledger/production (or whatever location you have in core.yaml)
2. Remove the KeyValStore properties file - tests use test.properties from $user.home

Run the tests now and it should work
<@U2D13KBQD> This is not related to SDK, please post in <#C27E2LGJY|fabric-peer-dev>, see <https://github.com/hyperledger-archives/fabric/issues/580> for a similar problem

attachments.title: peer login fails with TLS failed loading external cert error · Issue #580 · hyperledger-archives/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: Assigning to @jeffgarratt since it looks like a TLS thing. Running obc-peer inside a Docker container. When I do a CLI login, I get back a "error on client login: open: no such file or directory" ...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: peer login fails with TLS failed loading external cert error · Issue #580 · hyperledger-archives/fabric
